intro: Elizabetha bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored elizabetha, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its distinctive bi-colored flowers, which typically feature a mix of white and pink or purple hues. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Elizabetha bicolor thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a suitable choice for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
